about_section_title: 25+ Years of Experience in Real Estate
about_section_desc: Real Estate Group specializes in the sale of detached houses, maisonettes, rental rooms, hotels, villas, and commercial spaces, in collaboration with experienced architects, civil engineers, and the best local craftsmen. Our twenty years of experience in buying and selling our own and third-party properties offers our clients the ideal guarantee of quality services. We undertake the sale of your property or the construction of your home with consistency, speed, and, above all, reliability! Our team includes experienced architects and civil engineers, as well as the best local craftsmen active in the area. Our company is housed in a privately owned building in Nea Vrasna. The buying and selling process is conducted with absolute confidentiality, in collaboration with local surveyors and a lawyer who speaks Greek, English, and Bulgarian. His goal is to ensure that clients from abroad are legally informed and confident about their purchase before the contract is signed. Our purpose is the correct and swift completion of the sale process, with our client's satisfaction as our primary concern.
faq1_question: What is the process for buying a property?
faq1_answer: The process begins with finding the right property, followed by legal and technical checks, signing a preliminary agreement, and finally, signing the final contract at the notary's office.
faq2_question: What documents are needed for a sale?
faq2_answer: For a sale, you need property titles, a tax clearance certificate, an energy performance certificate, a certificate from an engineer confirming no unauthorized constructions, and other documents depending on the case.
faq3_answer: Yes, we provide comprehensive management services for short-term rental properties, from promotion and bookings to cleaning and maintenance.
faq_intro_text: Buying a property is a big decision. We understand you have questions, so we’ve put together clear, honest answers to help you navigate the process and make informed decisions at every step.
faq4_question: Is a lawyer mandatory in real estate transactions?
faq4_answer: No, since 2014, a lawyer is not mandatory for signing a contract. However, legal advice is strongly recommended to protect your interests.
faq5_question: What kind of permit is required for construction or renovation?
faq5_answer: A building permit is required for new construction. For renovations, depending on the scope of work, you may need a small-scale works permit, an approval of works, or a full building permit.
faq6_answer: The Building ID is an electronic file that contains all the details of a building (permits, plans, legality). It is mandatory for every property transfer.
faq7_question: Do I need to declare a renovation to the authorities?
faq7_answer: Yes, most renovation works require some form of declaration or permit from the relevant municipality or planning office, depending on the size and type of work.
faq8_question: What is the status of unauthorized constructions or modifications?
faq8_answer: Unauthorized constructions must be legalized or demolished. There are various legalization procedures involving the payment of fines, depending on the date and nature of the unauthorized work.
faq9_question: Documents for Selling or Constructing a Property
faq9_answer: For a sale, you need titles, tax clearance, ENFIA certificate, energy certificate, and an engineer's certificate. For construction, you need a topographical survey, architectural plans, structural study, etc.
faq10_answer: Masonry buildings are traditional structures with load-bearing walls. Prefabricated buildings are manufactured off-site and assembled on location, offering speed and economy.
faq11_answer: Real estate agencies handle the finding, promotion, and negotiation of properties, providing specialized services to buyers and sellers.
